speaker: 30 Minute Category
text: Jay Kogen  ## Nominated  NAACP IMAGE AWARD
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series
text: Kim Coles  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _Act One.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Roz and Frasier are sat chatting.  There are color charts on the table. _

speaker: Roz
text: Why did I ever decide to redecorate my bathroom?  They give you about a thousand decisions to make.  After a while, you can't even tell the colors apart.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, perhaps my discerning decorative eye can be of some assistance, let me see here.

speaker: Frasier
text: This one's Ecruel, that's Eggshell and this of course is Nolove White.

speaker: Roz
text: Very good, Frasier.  Now let's see how you do on the color side. [_turns them over_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, I do hope you don't spend your entire vacation redecorating.  You know, you should get out, you know, have some fun, maybe even take a cruise?  You don't want to stay in your apartment cooped up with a bunch of sweaty workmen.

speaker: Frasier
text: _Bon Voyage._

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, and don't worry, Chuck Ranberg said he'd take over for the week-

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, absolutely not, Roz!  The man's speech impediment will make me giggle all week long.

speaker: Roz
text: Show a little compassion!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, you try dealing with a call screener who says, "Doctaw Cwane, we have a kweptomaniac on wine fwee."

speaker: Roz
text: Well, who do you want to use?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, I was thinking of reaching out to the community.  You know, I was guest speaker last month at a program called "Second Start."  They offer career training for people who are stuck in tedious, low-paying jobs.  And, em, well, I'd thought I'd give the job to one of those students.

speaker: Roz
text: That's a great idea, Frasier.  Sounds like a great program. [_N.B. Chuck Ranberg is the name of one of the show's writers._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, there's Chuck Ranberg.  Roz, you've got to tell him he doesn't have the job.

speaker: Roz
text: Why can't you tell him?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I can't hear the man speak without just descending into giggles.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you are such a child!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mumbles hurrying her_]

speaker: Chuck
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Chuck, how's it going?

speaker: Chuck
text: Oh, tewwible, Woz!  My wife was in the Cawwibean and she weft me for a Wastafawian! _Roz starts laughing uncontrollably as Frasier pats her arm trying to cover up by pretending she is crying.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Radio Station. We see a Seattle tram pass by with an advert promoting Frasier's show. There is a picture of Frasier and a slogan with the words "I'm Listening."  CUT TO: The Studio. Frasier is talking to the temporary call screener, Mary Thomas, a jolly black woman of around thirty years._

speaker: Frasier
text: We only have a couple of minutes before the show, so listen, tell me a little bit about yourself.  How did you get interested in broadcasting?

speaker: Mary
text: Well, after I got laid off from the bakery, I guess I had some free time.  So I took a few different night school courses and when I got to the one in radio, it all clicked.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, isn't that funny?  You know, I had almost exactly the same experience.  I first discovered psychiatry in Dr. Badgley's epidemiology seminar at Harvard.

speaker: Mary
text: Except I bet you didn't walk though a metal detector to get to class!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, but, you know, I did have to pass under a dangerously unbalanced portrait of Alfred Adler in the Rotunda! [_laughs_]

speaker: Mary
text: We are practically separated at birth!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ten seconds, Mary, coming up.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, I'm so nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you'll be fine, just relax.

speaker: Mary
text: Okay. [_sits in her seat as Frasier sits in his_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] Hello, Seattle.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane and I'm listening.  I'd like to take this opportunity to introduce someone who's going to bring her own flavor to the show this week while Roz is gone.  Say hello to Mary Thomas. [_Mary nods; encouraging her to talk_] It's great to have you with us, Mary. [_Mary only smiles_] You know, we want to get right to your calls, folks.  So, we'll be right back after this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary, I should mention that you should feel free to speak on the air.  You know, Roz often chimes in from time to time.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, I can't believe I messed up so quickly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, no, not at all, not at all.  Just promise me that you'll speak up when it feels right.

speaker: Mary
text: I will!

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, great, I'm sure you have excellent instincts.

speaker: Mary
text: Five seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] And we're back.  All right, Mary, who's our first caller?

speaker: Mary
text: [_emphasized_] Maria! [_Frasier urges her to carry on_] Er, she's thirty-six years old... married five years... and her husband's been staying late at the office so he can meet with his secretary.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_happy for Mary_] That's the way to do it! [_realizing_] I mean, I'm sorry, Maria, em, I'm Listening.

speaker: Maria
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane.  Anyway, he's having an affair and it's not his first.  This has been going on since we were newlyweds.  How do I get him to change?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Maria.  You of course know it's impossible to force anyone to change.  But you can work to change yourself. Usually women that tolerate this sort of behavior from their husbands are suffering from low self-esteem issues, you may need some counseling to resolve those issues.  Let me ask you a couple of questions...

speaker: Mary
text: May I say something?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Mary
text: Maria, Dr. Crane is right.  You must make a change.  And the first thing you change is the lock on your front door.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not too pleased_] What?

speaker: Maria
text: Oh, listen, there's plenty of time for counselors, but at six o'clock locksmiths start charging extra, so you get on it, girlfriend.  You know, my Grampa Willie used to say, "Nothing stops a man from playing the field faster than a night out on the lawn."  Okay?  Okay!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Grampa Willie! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Three - Radio Station -- Some Time Later Mary is giving more counseling. _

speaker: Mary
text: Looky here, Tony.  You're thirty-five years old.  Now, your parents only had you for the first eighteen, so if you want to start blaming someone, maybe you need to blame yourself. Okay?  Okay!

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, chronic rage problems usually stem from childhood...

speaker: Mary
text: All right, Dr. Crane, we're all out of time.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks at clock_] So we are.  Well then, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, saying goodbye Seattle, and good mental health. [_goes to press button_]

speaker: Mary
text: And tune in tomorrow! _Frasier angrily punches the button with a bemused look.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. The apartment is empty except for Daphne as she opens the door to Niles who is carrying a certificate._

speaker: Niles
text: [_full of the joys of spring_] Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, you're in a good mood today.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm-mm, after six long weeks I have finally received my yellow belt.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, aren't you lucky?  I ordered some more Capri pants two months ago and I'm still waiting.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no.  As this handsome certificate will attest, I've finally attained the second level of kickboxing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, congratulations.  What made you take up kickboxing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, in order to protect Mel.  Er, as you know, she's a plastic surgeon.  She has a habit of slipping her card to total strangers who she feels could use her services.  So far no harm done, but... [_pours sherry_]

speaker: Daphne
text: But it's only a matter of time before you get your lights punched out?

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly.  It almost happened last week with Marjorie Dunsmore. Luck was on our side, but next time there might not be a walker to kick over, so... [_beat_] I think Dad'll be properly impressed when I demonstrate my precision in footwork. _Niles demonstrates to Daphne and gets a little too close to the Chihuly on the side._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  It's very impressive, Dr. Crane.  You know, I just remembered the Chihuly needs a good dusting.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters and notices_] Daphne, I thought you cleaned that yesterday?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, did I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles.  What brings you here?

speaker: Niles
text: Here to demonstrate my newly acquired feet [_high kicks shouting "hu-ho!"_] of fury!

speaker: Frasier
text: Carry on, Daphne. [_pours a sherry as Daphne exits to the kitchen and Martin enters and sits in his chair_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, who was that woman on your show today?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that was Mary Thomas, she's filling in for Roz this week.

speaker: Martin
text: It seemed to me like she was filling for you!

speaker: Niles
text: You're normally so particular about what happens on your show.  I'm surprised you let her go on like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I started to say something and then I thought, well, it might be a bit condescending.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits_] I know why you didn't say anything; cause she's black!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's ridiculous, Dad, race has nothing to do with it.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come now, Frasier.  You can't deny a certain measure of guilt, living as you do in your exclusive lily-white world.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, owning the CD of "Ella sings Gershwin" does not qualify you as a soul brother!

speaker: Martin
text: You know, Frasier, there's such a thing as being too sensitive about this stuff.  Now if it was Roz blabbing on instead of this Mary, you'd tell her to put a sock in it, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose so, but, you know, this is different, Dad. She's just starting out, I didn't want to squelch her enthusiasm.

speaker: Martin
text: Because she's black.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, will you just stop saying that?  Anyway, I will just have to deal with it for a week until Roz gets back.

speaker: Martin
text: Black!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!

speaker: Niles
text: [_suddenly after a pensive time_] My first roommate at Yale was black!

speaker: Frasier
text: Huntington Treadwell III!  It's hardly representative of the African-American experience, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: His father was a pioneer in Selma and Montgomery.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I believe he built golf courses all over the South!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, speaking of golf, dad, I've become quite the sportsman myself. [_hands him certificate_] What do you think of that?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's very nice, son, but calligraphy really isn't a sport!  More of a craft.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, this is for kickboxing, I finally reached yellow belt, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: He-hey, what do you know?  I'm proud of ya!

speaker: Martin
text: No, come here. [_they high-five_]

speaker: Niles
text: You know, it requires a lot of talent.  You have to have timing and balance, the ability to strike and instantly retreat.

speaker: Martin
text: [_clarifying_] So you kick them and then run away?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  My instructor says I'm a natural.  Can I show you something?

speaker: Martin
text: [_taking his beer onto another table for safety_] Yeah, sure.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll show you a roundhouse kick, all right? _Niles does his maneuvers with his back to the kitchen.  Daphne enters from the kitchen with a tray of snacks and watches Niles in admiration._

speaker: Niles
text: You sense your assailant's presence. [_weird eye movement_] You feel your body in the space. [_weird feet movement_] Know where your opponent is and when you're ready... you strike! _Niles kicks behind him and inadvertently knocks Daphne flying onto the table as she throws the bowl of snacks up behind her.  She lands on her wrist as Niles goes to help her._

speaker: Niles
text: What have I done?!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you all right, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cries_] No.  I landed on my wrist, it's really throbbing...

speaker: Martin
text: Go get her some ice, Niles! [_he does_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, perhaps you're right.  Maybe I am too sensitive. [_the phone rings_] Daphne, could you get that, please? _Frasier exits to the kitchen as the rest look around at him.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Radio Station. Frasier and Mary are coming towards the end of their show._

speaker: Frasier
text: Gabe, you must remember that compulsive shopping is an addiction.  There are no simple solutions.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, I've got one!  Cut those credit cards up right now.  Okay? Okay!

speaker: Gabe
text: [_v.o._] Thank you, Dr. Mary.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I hate to be a stickler here, Gabe, but as Mary would be the first to point out: she is not a doctor.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, I don't mind.  Call me Dr. Mary.  You know, Latifa's not a real Queen, right?  [_N.B. Kim Coles starred with Queen Latifah on "Living Single."_]

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, you know what, doll babies, we're all out of time for today.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks at clock_] So we are.  Well then, this is Dr. Frasier Crane...

speaker: Mary
text: ...and Dr. Mary!

speaker: Frasier
text: Saying goodbye Seattle and... [_quick_] good mental health. [_presses button before she can open her mouth_]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, guys. [_Mary enters to greet him_] Just checking in to see how things are going.

speaker: Mary
text: Are you kidding, it's a dream come true. [_exits to her booth_]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_closes door between booths_] So, er, you and Mary, what do you think of her?  Be honest.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I genuinely like her, she's delightful and dedicated.

speaker: Kenny
text: And...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, em, she does have a tendency to just sort of jump right in there whenever she likes, you know, and frankly, her method of solving problems is totally different than mine. [_laughs to cover fear of prejudice_]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_genuine laugh_] Yeah, I'm nuts about her too. [_Mary enters_] The contrast between you guys, that's what gets things crackling.  I always thought that your show was the gold standard of radio shrink chatter.  But this last week has been even better!

speaker: Frasier
text: You think so?

speaker: Kenny
text: Absolutely!  In fact, the boys upstairs would like to make you two a permanent team.  Oh, who am I kidding?  There are no boys upstairs, I just love this show! [_imitating Mary_] Okay?

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, this is so exciting, I cannot believe it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, me neither!

speaker: Kenny
text: And don't you worry about Roz.  I'm just going to switch her over to Gil's show.  The hours are better and I'll even throw in a twenty percent raise!  Ah, this is going be great!  I bet within a month you guys are going to have the hottest ratings in Seattle!

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, this is so wonderful, thank you both, really.  I'm going to go call my parents. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Kenny...

speaker: Kenny
text: I know what you're feeling right now, Doc, and let me save you the trouble. [_opens arms_] Come here, big guy!

speaker: Mary
text: I want some too! _Mary flings herself around Frasier, sandwiching him in.  We CUT TO: the streets of Seattle again.  This time the tram has a large picture of Frasier and a small picture of Mary with the caption, "Frasier Crane featuring Dr. Mary"  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Niles has taken on Daphne's role in the apartment.  He has got Daphne settled on the couch whilst Martin sits in his chair.  Niles gives Daphne a quiche._

speaker: Niles
text: Everything comfy, Daphne?  There you are.  This quiche should hold you 'til dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, you really don't need to fill in for me, it's just a sprained wrist.  I'm perfectly capable of cooking dinner.

speaker: Martin
text: The hell you are!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, it is the least I can do, believe me.  Until you're fully recovered, consider me your full-time stand-in.  Oh, which reminds me, Dad.  I rented your favorite video. [_hands it to him_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_cheerful_] Oh-ho, "Death Wish."

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'll get your beer, I'm just frosting the mug in the freezer the way Daphne does.

speaker: Daphne
text: I never frost your beer mug!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, be quiet, will you?  He's feeling very guilty and we have to help him work through it.

speaker: Daphne
text: That is just baloney, and you know it.  Shame on you, taking advantage of your son, I don't know how you sleep at night!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, pretty good since he started putting a mint on my pillow and a cup of cocoa by the bed.

speaker: Daphne
text: He never leaves me cocoa.

speaker: Martin
text: You have to fill out that little card.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh. _Daphne exits to her room as Niles enters with Martin's snacks. Frasier also enters from the outside hallway._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Fras, how did the show go?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives him a look_] It was very educational.  Today, Mary taught us how to manipulate our husbands... by withholding sex.  And she taught us how to lie to our children about the past.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs with Niles_] Boy, that Dr. Mary sure goes on and on.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] For the last time! - she is not a doctor, no matter how many times she refers to herself as one.  "A cat can have kittens in the oven but that don't make 'em biscuits!" [_realizes_] Dear God, now I'm quoting Grampa Willie!  [_N.B. The drier version of this saying which Frasier might well already know would be the Duke of Wellington's aphorism that "a man may be born in a stable, that doesn't make him a horse."  He grew fond of saying it in response to questions about whether he considered himself Irish or English._]

speaker: Niles
text: For heaven's sake, Frasier, why don't you just talk to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a delicate situation, Niles.  For God's sake, it's not all that easy.  I mean, she is new to the field, she's sensitive, she's eager to please...

speaker: Martin
text: She's black!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know damn well that's what this whole thing's about. I don't know what the big deal is, if she's talking too much, just tell her to shut her big bazoo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  How do you suggest I accomplish that without sounding like a complete bigot?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps a little diplomacy is in order.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, are you saying I should just choose my words more carefully, is that it?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, exactly.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hot under the collar_] Fine, fine, all right, Niles.  Just exactly how would that go?!  Why don't you play me and I'll be Mary.

speaker: Niles
text: All right. [_calm_] Er, Mary?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quick_] Frasier!

speaker: Niles
text: I've been meaning to speak to you.  You know, people listen to the show for my expertise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, so my opinion's not worth anything?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm the one with the medical degree.  Now I want you to contribute, but only up to a point.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you want me to stay in my place, Massa!

speaker: Niles
text: She's not going to say "Massa"... _Frasier throws in stereotypical African-American woman speech and gestures, including the neck rolling._

speaker: Frasier
text: What, am I getting too uppity for you?  You sherry-swelling, opera-loving, Armani-wearing elitist!  You have no idea how difficult it is for a black woman in a white man's world!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think so! [_breaking up_] Look at me!  This is ridiculous.  I have walked myself straight into a mine field!

speaker: Niles
text: Listen, Frasier.  I know you're trying to be sensitive, but you're not showing this woman any respect if you're not as honest with her as you would be with someone else.

speaker: Martin
text: Right, this is your show.  When she gets her own show she can say whatever she wants.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes_] Wait a minute!  You know what, Dad, you may be onto something there.  Gosh, I don't know why I didn't think of that myself.  You know what, I'm just going to call Kenny and tell him to give her her own show.  They're looking for a replacement for "Let's Go Camping With Dan & Jenny."

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to them?

speaker: Frasier
text: They don't know. [_on phone_] Kenny, it's Frasier.  Listen, I've been thinking.  You know what, I think I'm holding Mary back.  You know, a talent like hers should not be stuck in a producer's chair. [_happy to Niles and Martin_] He agrees with me! _Niles and Martin look at each other in satisfaction.  SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Three - Radio Station. However, Kenny got the wrong end of the stick it seems as now Mary and Frasier are both in the talent's booth on the same show._

speaker: Mary
text: [_to microphone_] Oh, I'll tell you what you do, you snap out of it.  You know why you're afraid to get married?  You think there's some room full of hoochy mommas out there that's waiting for you, in case you don't want to do the right thing. Let me tell you something, the only thing you're missing out on is a lot of cold and lonely nights and I tell you what, there's not one person out there that would disagree with me on that. Louise: I do!  I don't think he deserves that girl and if he's not man enough to take that leap of faith then she's better off without him!

speaker: Mary
text: Louise, is you trippin'?  Girls... _Louise and Mary start arguing over each other.  Frasier sits silently between the two and in boredom takes a bite of cheese.  We then CUT BACK TO the Seattle tram.  Now it's advertisement has Mary and Frasier standing back to back with a little picture of Louise.  It now reads "They're Listening!"  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is having a coffee as Roz enters and sits with him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  I listened to your show for about twenty minutes today, I didn't hear your voice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm playing a diminished role these days.  Although still an important one.  I am the glue that holds the show together - or as Mary said in her intro, "The filling in our little Oreo."

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's no picnic working with Gil either.  You know that little joke that he makes before every show that his taste buds are insured?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.

speaker: Roz
text: They really are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Roz
text: Guess who had to take the claims photo after he had to eat a hot slice of pizza?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, Roz, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: You should be.  I go away for a week and you give away our whole show!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know. [_Mary enters_] Oh, Lord, there she is.  You know what, I could have nipped this whole thing in the bud if I'd just been honest with her from the beginning.  You know what, perhaps the time's come for me to just tell her the truth.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it sounds like an intense conversation.  I think I'll get out of here and give you a little room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz! _Roz leaves to the back of the caf e. _

speaker: Mary
text: [_comes over_] Hey there, partner.  Is there room for one more at the doctor's table?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Mary.  Listen, there is something I want to talk to you about.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, I don't doubt it.  Could you believe Louise today?  She just would not stop talking, would she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not Louise...

speaker: Mary
text: Every time I turned around she's just yappity, yappity, yappity, yap.  I mean, what is her training anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary, please, just stop it, stop it.  Please, the problem is not with Louise, it's with you.

speaker: Mary
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the truth is, I... I don't enjoy working with you. I haven't enjoyed working with you from the start. We have different styles and I have absolutely no respect for the advice that you give.

speaker: Mary
text: I... I had no idea.  Well, why didn't you just say something before?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pause_] Well, it's because you're black. [_she realizes_] And the truth is that I was afraid that if I said something critical of you, you might react the wrong way... and I feel just terrible about it.

speaker: Mary
text: Maybe you shouldn't feel so bad because...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, actually, I should.  You see, I pride myself on being able to communicate with just about anybody, and I couldn't even be honest with you.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, it's not that easy.  You didn't want to disappoint me, I understand.  If you don't like the show the way it is right now then that comes first.  Like Grampa Willie used to say, "If the shoe don't fit then that ain't your shoe."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, as much as I've come to loathe Grampa Willie, that does actually make me feel a little better.

speaker: Mary
text: You know, I'll let you in on a little secret.  All those expressions?  I made them up myself. [_laughs_] I'll give you another reason not to feel so bad about all this.  Today, KPXY offered me my own show.  I'm going to be just fine on my own.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary, that's wonderful news.  So, you forgive me?

speaker: Mary
text: Well, I think you could have been honest with me.  Then again, if you'd told me to be quiet then I'd be back at the bakery. Instead, I've got this brand-new career and this afternoon I'm shopping for cars.  So I guess what I'm saying is... God bless your guilty white ass!  Okay? _Mary kisses him on his forehead leaving a lipstick mark and then exits.  Frasier wipes it off as Roz arrives at his table._

speaker: Roz
text: So, how'd it go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, better than I expected.  I guess we're a team again, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Great. [_they shake hands_] Well, you'll have to wait a little while.  I've got to stay with Gil at least until we find another replacement.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course.  Well, I can find somebody. _FADE TO:  Scene Five - Radio Station. Frasier is doing his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you for your call, Jill.  Well, Chuck, who else is on the line?

speaker: Chuck
text: Weww, Doctaw Cwane, we have Winda on wine fwee who bewieves peopew are waffing at hew.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_containing his laughter_] Maybe we can just come back to that one, shall we?

speaker: Chuck
text: All wightey! _Frasier controls his laughter again as we FADE OUT.  End of Act Two._
